Game3

Class Game3

  • java.lang.Object
    • Game3.Game3
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Game3
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Since:
    2015-11-02 The Game Handler for the final game This will handle all logic, Input and Graphics for the final game
    Version:
    0.1
    Author:
    Brendan, Danielle, David, Huayu and Zhanglong
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Game3(double time, int score, int money, int tickCount, java.util.ArrayList<Plant> plants, java.util.ArrayList<Runoff> enemies, java.util.ArrayList<Mussel> mussels, java.util.ArrayList<Tile> tiles, boolean gameRunning, boolean gameOver, OverallGame bigGame, javax.swing.JPanel gamePanel, javax.swing.JPanel bigGamePanel, javax.swing.JFrame gameFrame, javax.swing.JLabel timeAndScore, long startTime, javax.swing.Timer timer, javax.swing.JPopupMenu menu, javax.swing.JProgressBar timeBar, java.util.ArrayList<javax.swing.JLabel> coins, javax.swing.JLabel totalCoin, javax.swing.JLabel pipes, java.awt.Image endImage, javax.swing.JMenuItem grass, javax.swing.JMenuItem mangrove, java.awt.event.ActionListener grassListen, java.awt.event.ActionListener mangroveListen)
      Generic Constructor For use with reinitializing with serializeable
      Game3(OverallGame bigGame)
      Game Constructor Produces the initial game state (time = 40.0, score = 0, money = 900, no plants or runoff, 4 Mussels in pseudorandom positions)

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addMoney(int amount)
      Adds the given amount to the player's money Used for testing and for mussel collection
      void addMussel()
      Creates a new mussel and adds it to the game in a random, non colliding position
      void addPlant(int row, int col, java.lang.String type)
      Adds a plant to the current game from a player choice in a menu screen Plants can only be bought if the player has enough money the args will be passed by the useMenu method
      void addRunoff()
      Adds some runoff to the game at a random point this is called periodically based on difficulty update will tell the function where to place the runoff
      void addScore(int score)
      Adds a score to the player's score
      void battle(Plant plant, Runoff runoff)
      Computes a fight between a plant and some runoff (Health - Strength) If the runoff dies it gives the player score and money If the runoff dies it removes the runoff from the lane
      static java.lang.Object deserialize(java.lang.String fileName)
      Method to read a game state from file and instantiate it.
      void endGame(java.lang.String highScoreLoc)
      If the game ends, passes the score to the overall score And sets the overall shell to the running state and calls the update method on the overall shell
      static java.awt.Image getBackground() 
      OverallGame getBigGame()

      void initPanel(javax.swing.JFrame frame)
      Creates the game panel and sets up the timer Won't be tested as this is basically the view method plus a constructor
      boolean isGameOver() 
      boolean isGameRunning() 
      void menuRegen()
      Regenerates the Menu for buying plants once a new click has been made wUsed to handle errors received previously involving planting plants in every clicked location
      void moveRunoff()
      Moves each runoff if some time has passed (3s right now) If the runoff reaches the end it kills a mussel If the runoff reaches a plant it fights the plant
      void onClick(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
      The player can click on the button to exit the game OR Click on a tile and the method will prompt the player for which plant they want to place If the player clicks on a plant to buy, this will prompt the player to place the plant If the player clicks on a Mussel, the mussel is harvested for money and a new mussel appears If the player clicks on the exit button, the game will pause and prompt them to exit WITHOUT sending the score or setting the game complete boolean to true
      void onClickForTesting(int y, int x)
      This method is used for testing the onClick method without simulating clicks.
      static void serialize(java.lang.Object obj, java.lang.String fileName)
      Method to serialize OverallGame, which contains the other games as params So this output will contain the serialized version of every object

      void update()
      Updates the game state and checks for player input This includes the time remaining, character actions and movement, and updating the score and money

    • Method Detail

      • initPanel

        public void initPanel(javax.swing.JFrame frame)
        Creates the game panel and sets up the timer Won't be tested as this is basically the view method plus a constructor
        Parameters:
        frame -

      • update

        public void update()
        Updates the game state and checks for player input This includes the time remaining, character actions and movement, and updating the score and money

      • onClick

        public void onClick(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
        The player can click on the button to exit the game OR Click on a tile and the method will prompt the player for which plant they want to place If the player clicks on a plant to buy, this will prompt the player to place the plant If the player clicks on a Mussel, the mussel is harvested for money and a new mussel appears If the player clicks on the exit button, the game will pause and prompt them to exit WITHOUT sending the score or setting the game complete boolean to true
        Parameters:
        e - - The location and nature of the user's click

      • menuRegen

        public void menuRegen()
        Regenerates the Menu for buying plants once a new click has been made wUsed to handle errors received previously involving planting plants in every clicked location

      • addPlant

        public void addPlant(int row,
                     int col,
                     java.lang.String type)
        Adds a plant to the current game from a player choice in a menu screen Plants can only be bought if the player has enough money the args will be passed by the useMenu method
        Parameters:
        row - - the row of the plant to be made
        col - - the col of the plant to be made
        type - - the type of plant to be placed

      • addRunoff

        public void addRunoff()
        Adds some runoff to the game at a random point this is called periodically based on difficulty update will tell the function where to place the runoff
        Parameters:
        row - - the row of the runoff to be made
        col - - the column of the runoff to be made

      • moveRunoff

        public void moveRunoff()
        Moves each runoff if some time has passed (3s right now) If the runoff reaches the end it kills a mussel If the runoff reaches a plant it fights the plant

      • battle

        public void battle(Plant plant,
                   Runoff runoff)
        Computes a fight between a plant and some runoff (Health - Strength) If the runoff dies it gives the player score and money If the runoff dies it removes the runoff from the lane
        Parameters:
        plant - - the plant object that the runoff ran into
        runoff- - the runoff object that ran into the plant

      • addMussel

        public void addMussel()
        Creates a new mussel and adds it to the game in a random, non colliding position

      • addMoney

        public void addMoney(int amount)
        Adds the given amount to the player's money Used for testing and for mussel collection
        Parameters:
        amount - - the amount of money to be added

      • endGame

        public void endGame(java.lang.String highScoreLoc)
        If the game ends, passes the score to the overall score And sets the overall shell to the running state and calls the update method on the overall shell
        Parameters:
        highScoreLoc - - file name of high score

      • addScore

        public void addScore(int score)
        Adds a score to the player's score
        Parameters:
        score - - the score to be added

      • onClickForTesting

        public void onClickForTesting(int y,
                              int x)
        This method is used for testing the onClick method without simulating clicks. the method is a duplicate of onclick so that method won't have to be tested
        Parameters:
        y -
        x -
